Mayor and City Council

The Greenville City Council is comprised of a Mayor elected at-large and six single-member district Councilmembers who are elected for three-year terms to represent the citizens of the City of Greenville.

The Event Category dropdown filters meetings by board(s).Visit our Archive Center to view historical agendas and minutes.

Vision Statement


The Vision of the City of Greenville is to build on our hometown values and rich heritage as a diverse community, by providing cost-effective, quality services to create an enjoyable, vibrant place where families and businesses choose to live, grow and prosper.

  1. 2024-2025 Goals

2024-2025 Goals

The following goals were adopted at the June 11, 2024, City Council meeting by Resolution 24-61.

 Goal 1 - Build  Infrastructure for greater sustainability

  • Goal 2 - Planned  approach for improving current water infrastructure 
  • Goal 3 - Strive for Municipal excellence and enhance opportunities for communication
  • Goal 4 - Preserve the character of Greenville while preparing for flexible and sustainable growth
  • Goal 5 - Support Public Service, Health, and Safety
  • Goal 6 - Optimize opportunities at the Airport
  • Goal 7 - Preserve the architecture and green space of current city owned spaces/facilities while striving for and promoting beautification within the city
  • Goal 8 - Completion and implementation of the Downtown Plan

 

Addressing Council - City Council meetings and workshops are open to the public and citizen input is welcome. Citizens may speak at council meetings on agenda and non-agenda items by completing and submitting a Citizens Comment Card. Once you have completed your form, please present your card to the city secretary prior to the start of the meeting.  Cards are available at City Hall on the day of the meeting. The mayor will ask those wishing to address the council to do so at the appropriate time. Please approach the speaker's podium in the center of the Council Chamber, state your name and address for the official meeting records, and discuss the specific agenda item or topic of interest.

The City Council agenda is available on the website 72 hours prior to every meeting. The agendas are posted in the west foyer of City Hall in the glass public notice case adjacent to the City Hall entrance.


The City Charter of Greenville provides for a Council-Manager form of local government. The Mayor and Councilmembers function as the policy-making body of the City's government, determining the overall goals, objectives, and direction for city services, and adopting the annual operating budgets for all City Departments.

A Message from Mayor Jerry Ransom


 Welcome to Greenville, Texas, and thank you for taking the opportunity to learn what so many families and businesses have already discovered about our warm and friendly community. 
 Located less than an hourâ€™s drive from the Dallas-Fort Worth area, Greenville is ideally situated to offer the conveniences of a big city alongside the small-town atmosphere that East Texans treasure. 
 
 Our growing and diverse business community includes major defense contractor and aerospace industry leader L-3 Mission Integration, global specialty chemicals and materials companies Cytec Industries Inc., FSTI and Fritz Industries, major oilfield service company Weatherford Inc., and world-class agricultural and construction equipment manufacturer CNH (Case New Holland). A growing pool of small businesses speaks to the entrepreneurial spirit of this area, as well as an expanding local economy.
 
Our school district boasts a world-champion robotics team and inventive programs such as Destination Imagination and Suzuki Strings that develop our childrenâ€™s interests in math, science and the arts in creative and innovative ways. We pride ourselves on providing a quality local parks system, including the Greenville SportsPark, and activities to keep our youth engaged and active. 
 
 Downtown Greenvilleâ€™s wineries, eateries and retail shops cater to diverse interests and host numerous community events throughout the year. The revitalization projects in our Main Street district honors the cityâ€™s rich history. The Texan Theater and our own GMA (Greenville Municipal Auditorium) bring entertainment to our doorstep by regularly featuring accomplished musical artists through the Threadgill Concert Series, Greenville Entertainment Series and Dallas Symphony in Greenville. 
 I invite you to join us as we continue to grow and share a rich heritage and a vibrant future.
 
 Welcome home to Greenville!
 
 Jerry Ransom
Mayor of Greenville

Request a Mayoral Proclamation


The City of Greenville offers ceremonial proclamations to recognize outstanding community contributions, important events, nonprofit work, and public awareness campaigns. Proclamations are issued at the discretion of the Mayor and must follow established guidelines.
